Application Question(s):

* Ahmad is working with his team when another supervisor comes up to him and says, "You should keep an eye on the incompetent people who work for you. They left a mess yesterday that my team had to clean up." Ahmad was unaware of the incident.

What should Ahmad say to her?  
A. Tell her that he'd prefer to talk about it in private later  
B. Tell her that she's being unprofessional  
C. Ask her if she has proof that his team left the mess  
D. Thank her for letting him know and promise to talk to his team  
E. Apologize for the mess on behalf of his team

* A prospective client tells you she has used your main competitor for 10 years and likes their product.

What would you do?  
A. Ask what she would change about your competitor’s product  
B. Acknowledge the long-standing relationship, but tell her you should be her supplier  
C. Tell her about your product and leave a sample  
D. Highlight your competitor’s drawbacks and how your product is superior  
E. Thank her for her time and ask for referrals you can pursue

* As an assistant manager, you've noticed a significant decline in team productivity over the past month.

What would you do first?  
A. Schedule a team meeting to discuss the issue and gather feedback on potential obstacles  
B. Implement mandatory overtime for all team members to increase output  
C. Tell the team you're disappointed about the decline in productivity and ask them to improve  
D. Request additional resources from upper management  
E. Identify the team members who have been least productive and ask them to improve

title: Associate
description:
New York, New York
Job Description
Duties: Litigate, manage and try international arbitration matters before international tribunals and cross-border litigation matters before New York federal and state courts; research legal issues in both international commercial arbitration and international investment arbitration; interview witnesses to assist with the preparation of written witness statements and to develop facts of assigned cases; draft pleadings for international arbitrations, including requests for arbitration, statements of claim or defense, requests for interim measures, challenges to party-appointed arbitrators, post-hearing briefs, and costs applications; handle non-administered ad-hoc arbitrations; attend and assist with conferences and jurisdictional and merit hearings in international arbitrations; engage in discovery practice, including e-discovery; and attend hearings and trials to assist partners and senior associates.  

  

Requirements: Juris Doctor (J.D.) or Master of Laws (L.L.M.) degree in Law and two (2) years of related experience as an Associate and must include: Drafting pleadings for international arbitrations, including statements of claim or defense, requests for interim measures, and challenges to party appointed arbitrators; Working with civil law systems including Latin American jurisdictions; Cross-examining fact witnesses and experts including delivering oral arguments in arbitration hearings; and Researching complex matters of law related to both international commercial arbitration and international investment arbitration. Requires license to practice law in the State of New York. Also requires 10% -20% domestic and international travel.  

Hours: Full-time.
Salary for this role dependent on skillset and experience: $153,254 - $225,000/year.

title: Dental Assistant/Oral Surgery Assistant
description:
**Who:**  
We are a premier dental office specializing in oral implantology and we are seeking a:

**skilled oral surgical / dental assistant.**

We are located in Armonk, NY within Westchester County. For those who are unfamiliar, Armonk is about 10-min from White Plains, NY and about 20-min from Stamford, CT.

**What:** 

You as a skilled oral-surgical / dental **assistant** will assist the dental surgeon in predominantly the following treatments and procedures: infection removal, extraction, bone grafting, dental implant placement, healing factor placement, monitoring the patient during iv sedation, and suturing of surgical sites, etc., and those associated assisting techniques involved.

**Experience,** the Candidate must have:

**- Prior experience** in dental assisting and / or oral surgical assisting.

- **At least, 2+ years on the job experience** as a dental or oral surgical assistant.

- Formal training from a dental assisting academy or school highly considered and **a plus**.

- a working knowledge of dental instruments, tools, procedures, parts, equipment and techniques

incorporated into specific procedures or treatments.

**Skill Set & Attributes,** the Candidate should have and / or be:

- **Attention to Detail** while keeping the entire treatment in the scope of work.

- **Organized Professional** who can think under pressure

- **Ability to multi-task** (for example: monitoring the patient under iv sedation while assisting the

surgeon in the procedure)

- **Forward-Thinker,** be prepared for the next step in the procedure and have a working

understanding of the treatment as a whole.

- **Communicative Person**, who professionally, and calmly addressing situations, patients and

tasks at hand.

- **Compassionate Professional,** who can be gentle with patients while getting accomplished what

needs to be done in the treatment of the patient.

-**Having a working understanding or knowledge of different dental procedures and treatments**

whether this is formal training or on the job experience training or both!

**Duties of the Surgical Assistant**:

-obtaining a complete and or updated patients’ medical history, condition, evaluation, etc.

-familiarizing yourself with; the **patient’s complete medical history**.

-asking key questions and assisting in obtaining the **necessary consent to treatment forms**.

-taking the necessary pre-treatment planning **digital x-rays** and **iCat 3-D Scan** (ready for doctors’ inspection and analysis.)

-being part of the **pre-treatment discussion** by understanding the techniques that will be used and instruments necessary to prepare the surgical room for a particular treatment and implant system we will using for the particular case.

-preparing in advance, the surgical suite ready for the particular patient with all instruments, tools, and equipment necessary for that treatment lined up in a chronological order of events.

-assisting the dental surgeon in the treatment, while being a second or third person monitoring the patient and critical monitors during sedation for the comfort and safety of the patient.

-being ready ‘with the next’ tool, instrument, or part the dental surgeon needs.

-assisting the dental surgeon and front desk in what is needed to restock the surgical suite, parts, or working stock of implants, biomaterials, necessary sedation supplies, etc.

-note taking and scribe work: assisting the doctor and front desk in documenting what was performed, what parts where used, and key dates, etc.

-post surgical information and instructions the patient needs

-making arrangements with front desk for Post Operative Follow Up visits with the patient.

**Additional Notations & Afterthoughts:**

This is a premier dental surgical practice; we pride ourselves on using the state-of-the-art equipment and techniques. We only purchase the best dental products and instruments for the finest results possible. No expense has been sparred in the development of the office – we want Only those individuals who want to be part of an esteemed team and can appreciate the level of care we bring to our patients different then other offices do. We strive to elevate the standard of care, and we want those individuals who want to be part of this team, are dedicated and willing to put in the hours. Please be a team player, compassionate, and above all care about what we do and be involved in our vision and goals.

Please send your resumes directly to:

acda.practicemagement@gmail.com

Thank You

title: Psychotherapist (Fee-For-Service) Suffolk County
description:
The Child Center of NY strengthens children and families with skills, opportunities, and emotional support to build healthy, successful lives. Founded in 1953, The Child Center of NY has become a powerful community presence throughout the city. With 50 locations and 100 programs in NYC’s most under-served communities, our 1,000+ results-oriented professionals make a difference for more than 40,000 children and their families each year.
  
  

HOME VISITS REQUIRED.
  
  

The Psychotherapist (OLP) is designed to prevent the progression of behavioral health needs through early symptom identification and intervention and may be provided to children/youth in need of assessment for whom behavioral health conditions have not yet been diagnosed.
  
  

**In this role you will:**  

* Work with children, adolescents and their families in their home and community environments.
* Complete comprehensive initial and ongoing assessment
* Develop a congruent treatment plan with actively including the child and family as to ensure medical necessity.
* Provide counseling services by way of psychotherapy, including therapeutic communication and interaction for the purpose of alleviating symptoms or functional limitations.
* Provide both in-person and telephone crisis intervention activities to any child that experiences psychiatric, behavioral, or situational distress.
* Documents all services provided both timely and accurately.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.


There is reimbursement for traveling expense.
  
Minimum Qualifications
  
* Must have a NYS LCSW, LMFT, LMHC or LMSW
* HOME VISITS REQUIRED, Ideally evenings or weekends
* Successful completion of the Mandated Reporter training.
* Ability to work amongst diverse social, cultural, and economic groups.
* Excellent written, verbal, and listening skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and have some knowledge and using Electronic Health Records (EHR).
* Excellent time management skills.
* Bilingual (preferred but not required) in one or more of the following: Spanish, Mandarin, Cantonese, Bengali and others, as depending upon the needs of the client and their family.


The Child Center of NY is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status or any other category protected by Federal, State or local law. title: Workers Compensation and Unemployment Representative
description:
Heart to Heart home is looking for an experienced professional to join our growing HR team! The position presents a wonderful growth opportunity as we continue to expand operations within our territories. Join our team and discover professional, caring and excellent service at its best.

**Responsibilities include:**

* Serve as the primary contact between the NYS Department of Labor and the Company.
* Effectively interpret and apply state laws and regulations in response to UI documents.

title: Client Executive 1- Culinary Operations
description:
Seeking a dynamic individual with a unique blend of culinary expertise, manufacturing acumen, and facilities management skills to fill its **Client Executive 1- Culinary Operations** role and oversee all culinary production **in Brooklyn, NY**. Reporting directly to a Client Executive 2, the successful candidate will work closely with company's Managers and oversee a team of approximately 98 client union employees.

**Must have manufacturing experience in order to understand the processes that drive production, and a focus on monitoring the finances and future capital spend for the enhancement and growth of the culinary center.** 

**This role represents a unique opportunity for a strategic thinker with a passion for food production, facilities management, and client service. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of food service delivery within the hospital, driving innovation, and ensuring operational excellence.**

**Must Have Experience: Quality Leadership, Finance, Union Management, Manufacturing (FDA, USDA)**

**Responsibilities for this role include:**

* **Culinary Operations Oversight:**
* Manage food production operations for more than 14 facilities within the hospital, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery
* Collaborate with culinary teams to execute menus developed by our in-house chef, maintaining consistency and quality across all locations
* Implement efficient manufacturing processes to scale production while adhering to regulatory standards and quality control measures
* **Facilities Management:**
* Oversee facilities related to food production, including kitchen facilities, equipment, and storage areas
* Coordinate maintenance activities to ensure operational efficiency and compliance with safety standards
* Optimize facility layout and workflow to enhance productivity and streamline operations
* **Client Interaction and Future Planning:**
* Act as the primary point of contact for client interaction, addressing concerns and proactively identifying opportunities for improvement
* Collaborate with clients to plan for future projects and expansions without disrupting ongoing production
* Anticipate client needs and develop strategies to enhance service offerings and meet evolving requirements
* **Financial Management:**
* Assume significant financial responsibility, ensuring prudent allocation of resources and meticulous budget management
* Account for every dollar spent, maintaining transparency and accountability in financial transactions
* Implement cost-saving measures and efficiencies to optimize financial performance
* **Union Employee Management:**
* Navigate the complexities of working with unionized employees, fostering positive labor relations and ensuring compliance with collective bargaining agreements
* Address employee concerns and grievances in a fair and equitable manner, promoting a collaborative and respectful work environment

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in large-scale food manufacturing and production, preferably within a healthcare or institutional setting
* Strong culinary background with a deep understanding of menu development and food service operations
* Expertise in facilities management, including knowledge of kitchen equipment, maintenance protocols, and safety regulations
* Exceptional client interaction skills with a track record of building and maintaining strong relationships
* Financial acumen with the ability to manage budgets, analyze financial data, and drive cost-saving initiatives
* Experience working with unionized labor and navigating labor relations dynamics.
* Familiarity with the New York market and regulatory environment
* Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills

**The company offers a full array of benefits including paid time off, holidays, medical, dental, vision, 401K and access to ongoing training and development programs, tuition reimbursement, plus health and wellness programs.**

**Must have:**

* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience.
* 5+ years of experience in large-scale food manufacturing and production.
* Proven experience in a healthcare or institutional setting.
* Strong culinary background with expertise in menu development and food service operations.
* Expertise in facilities management, including knowledge of kitchen equipment, maintenance protocols, and safety regulations.
* Experience managing a unionized workforce.
* Strong financial acumen with experience in budget management and cost-saving initiatives.
* Excellent client interaction skills with a track record of building and maintaining strong relationships.
* Familiarity with FDA and USDA regulations and compliance requirements.
* Strong organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills.

title: Security Escort (LGA Airport)
description:
IMMEDIATE HIRE SECURITY ESCORTS at LaGuardia Airport **\\*ALL SHIFTS\\***

JCM Business Solutions delivers professional facility management and security services to commercial, education, government, public and transportation facilities in America's Northeast region. We are looking to add to our talented team!

**LOCATION:** LaGuardia Airport in Queens, NY

**SUMMARY:** The Security Escort provides security detail as outlined in the post orders and establishes working relationships with customers, local law enforcement and fire departments. He/she will always perform job duties with a constant awareness of surroundings, making note of any and all activity that takes place in the assigned area and complies with all security requirements in a professional manner. The Security Escort’s is also responsible for checking all movement of personnel, clients, and transportation coming in and out of their designated area. The Security Escort performs all responsibilities with a focus on the needs of our customers and in accordance with our company standards.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

§ Responsible for the prevention and detection of unauthorized entry, presence, and movement of individuals and ground vehicles into or within the assigned area.

§ Ensure that all safety and security procedures are followed at all times.

§ Complete required training as directed by the company and Airport in a timely manner.

§ Ensure that outside Contractors are always properly identified and have their photo ID visible at all times.

§ Maintain detailed documentation and logs as required.

§ Perform security searches as required.

§ Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

**REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:**

§ **This Airport specific classification requires each incumbent to complete and pass a Transportation Security Administration/Federal Aviation Administration (TSA/FAA) 10-year employment history verification, which will include fingerprinting and a Criminal History Records Check (CHRC) prior to being considered for this position. This status must be maintained for the duration of employment at the airport.**

§ **Successful completion of the NYS Security Guard License OR NYS 8 Hour Pre-Assignment Course / NYS 16 Hour On-the-Job (OJT) course and the ability to furnish the certificate.**

§ A valid Driver's License

§ Successful completion of the OSHA 10 hour course as directed

§ Very strong customer service skills.

§ Very high attention to detail.

§ Must be able to communicate well and work well with a team.

§ The physical environment requires the employees to work both inside and outside in heat/cold, wet/humid, and dry/arid conditions. Frequently requires to use personal protective equipment due to job scope.

§ Must be authorized to work in the United States.

§ **Apart from religious observations, must be able to work a flexible schedule including evenings, weekends and holidays.**

**For immediate consideration, please apply and send us your contact information. You may also fax your information to us at (516) 826-0666 (secure fax). / Para la consideracion inmediata, por favor envianos por fax su informacion para nosotros al (516) 826-0666 (fax seguro).**

***WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. JCM provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, pregnancy or parental status, national origin or ancestry, citizenship status, disability, family medical history or genetic information, protected veteran status, political affiliation, arrest record, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, other non-merit based factors or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.***

title: Fulfillment Center Supervisor
description:
**About Yami:**

Founded in 2013, Yami’s mission is to bring the world closer for everyone to experience and enjoy. We make it easy to discover exciting flavors and trending products from Asia. Named Inc. Magazine’s fastest growing start-up on the ”Inc. 500 List.”, we’re committed to connecting people with authentic food, beauty, home, and wellness experiences through our e-commerce platform, iOS, and Android apps.

**Benefits & Compensation:**

* 401(k) matching
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance
* Paid time off (PTO): vacation, sick, and holidays
* Employee discount
* Coffee and snacks

**Summary:**

The supervisor of the Fulfillment Center provides leadership for the Fulfillment Center operation team. This person will be responsible for the operation of specific warehouse division activities. You will have the opportunity to coach and develop your Yami associates team. The major focus is to motivate, mentor, and manage your team. You will ensure the production, efficiency, and quality requirement in one or multiple functions among picking orders, packing, receiving, and stowing products while ensuring inventory accuracy, as well as safety management, problem-solving, and training programs. Excellent communication skills with all levels of management and staff will be imperative.

**Essential Job Responsibilities:**

* Provide operational supervision in a specific warehouse division with 10-50 associates, plan daily manpower needs, and set schedules to ensure the daily production capability and efficiency target.
* Maintain safety and 5S standards, conduct the safety training and 5S audit to comply with OSHA and company policies and procedures.
* Manage quality, productivity, inventory, equipment, facility management, and customer delivery promises, ensure the operational goals are met and the standards are established and followed.
* Resolve problems and address staffing needs, handle the complexities and have troubleshooting skills, be able to determine the root cause of defects, and implement corrective solutions by using DMAIC, and Lean tools.
* Mentor, supervise and develop associates and leaders in areas of responsibility, provide feedback and positive reinforcement, handle employee questions, and concerns, and follow up with the intent to maintain a positive work environment.
* Need to be data-driven, experienced with operation metrics, and can collect and analyze the existing data to conduct staff performance improvement initiatives.
* Collaborate with support teams including Process Engineer, ICQA, and HR to engage in daily Kaizen and projects.
* Participate in process reengineering or WMS optimization from the insight of on-site practice.

**Qualifications and Requirements:**

* 2-3+ years of management experience in a warehousing, manufacturing, eCommerce operation, or other relevant industries
* Strong communication skills in English
* High school Degree or above
* Dealing with Complexity
* Ability to work flexible a schedule and multitask

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Know lean manufacturing tools and could initiate Kaizen to bring continuous operation improvement.
* Mandarin Chinese or Spanish is preferred

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP)- Hackettstown NJ
description:
**BASIC FUNCTION:** Direct Support Professionals assist with direct supervision, training, and support to consumers in order to stimulate the development of positive behaviors, skills and functioning levels conducive to employment and daily living.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Direct Support Professionals assist with instruction and training of employees with developmental disabilities in the areas of pre-vocational trainings such as: production, cleaning, and grounds maintenance, and community activities.
* Interact with employees with developmental disabilities professionally, respectfully, compassionately and as a peer throughout the entire workday and on a daily basis.
* Follow behavior plans as written and in-serviced.
* Provide First Aid to any employee with developmental disabilities as necessary.
* Provide Crisis Intervention utilizing Crisis Management techniques.
* Develop constructive habilitation activities, which all consumers can participate.
* Assist employees with developmental disabilities with feeding, toileting, ambulating and other custodial care as dictated by clientele, disabilities and as assigned by supervisor or designee.
* Perform any paperwork and record keeping relating to vocational training, i.e. individual's production counts, progress reports and charts, incident reports etc. accurately and on a timely basis.
* Attend in-service trainings as requested by supervisor and/or administrative staff. The following trainings are mandatory and, therefore, are an employment requirement: Medication, DD Overview, Abuse/Neglect, First Aid, and Crisis Training.
* Provide an organized, consistent, and structured environment.
* Set employees up for success and challenge them to progress to a higher level.
* Foster independence and adult behaviors.
* Willingly work with those who present challenging behaviors, exhibiting aggressive behaviors, are known Hepatitis B carriers, require physical assistance, one to one supervision and training, toileting and/or feeding assistance.
* Provide input into employee's program needs and goals in order to develop functional work and living skills.
* Tolerate prolonged standing, lifting, pushing, pulling and be able to ambulate throughout program to meet needs of people served.
* Communicate supplies and material needs to supervisor.
* Must be willing to accept varied job assignments, i.e. on-site training, off-site training, production, cleaning and provide van transportation/transportation aide, community and volunteer activities and serve as a back-up to job coaching and other centers. This includes accepting job assignment changes.
* Commitment to adhering to safe and healthy practices by complying with workplace safety and health policies and procedures.
* Ability to comply with Abilities attendance policy.
* Comply with both agency and Division of Developmental Disabilities policies and procedures.
* Will comply with the agency's Ethical Conduct Policy.

**SKILLS:**

* Good interpersonal skills with people in varied positions/agencies and consumers with different functioning levels and disabilities.
* Ability to grasp effective training methods.
* Ability to learn and carry out paperwork accurately requiring math and daily progress notes.
* Ability to accurately quality and quantity control production contracts.
* Proficient with technology (use of tablets, computers and Microsoft office Programs like Outlook, Word, Excel and Power Point)
* Tolerate prolonged standing, lifting, pushing, and pulling.

**EDUCATION/LICENSES:**

* High school diploma or GED.
* A valid license is required and driving record in good standing. Willingness to transport consumers in agency vehicles.

title: Field Technician
description:
Company Summary:

DISH, an EchoStar Company, has been reimagining the future of connectivity for more than 40 years. Our business reach spans satellite television service, live-streaming and on-demand programming, smart home installation services, mobile plans and products, and now we are building America’s First Smart Network™.  

Today, our brands include EchoStar, Hughes, DISH TV, Sling TV, Boost Infinite, Boost Mobile, DISH Wireless, OnTech and GenMobile.
Department Summary:

Our Technicians deliver TV and Smart Home solutions to millions of customers. As a technician, we will train you to lead the charge for a world-class customer experience, educating and connecting more Americans with every home you visit. You’re the backbone of our organization and ensure an excellent customer experience. Our dedication to customer experience is paying off: in 2023, DISH earned the J.D. Power award for being #1 in Overall Customer Satisfaction for the sixth year in a row.
Job Duties and Responsibilities:
**What’s in it for you?*** **Guaranteed promotion after 6 months with a $1.00 per hour pay increase!**
* **Performance Incentives** with the potential for up to **$6,400** in your first year and **$9,100** each following year!
* **Paid training, paid time off & paid holidays**
* **4-day work week with opportunities to work overtime**
* **Medical, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance packages and Health Savings Account**
* **Free DISH TV programming at a value of $114.99/month** at your home, plus deeply discounted **Sling TV** and **Boost Infinite** phone plans
* **401(K)** with company match **& Employee stock purchasing program (ESPP)**
* **Tuition Reimbursement**
* **DISH-supplied van, tools, and uniforms**

**Our greatest benefit is opportunity with over 400 of our current technician leadership starting as a technician.** If you have grit and tenacity, you will grow quickly at DISH! Performance based promotions include an automatic 5% pay increase at level 2 and 10% at levels 3 and 4. **What will you be doing?**  

As a Field Technician, you will be representing DISH in customers' homes daily. We build our value by simplifying lives and using the DISH install to consult homeowners on their infinite smart home possibilities.
Skills, Experience and Requirements:
*All technicians must have:** Aptitude to build rapport quickly. We want you to have a great time servicing our clients
* Ability to stand on a high ladder (up to 40 feet) for long periods of time, lift over 70 lbs at a time and remain within the individual weight limit requirements of 335 lbs
* Ability to crawl into small spaces and work in varying climates/weather conditions
* A valid driver's license in the state you are seeking employment with a driving record that meets DISH's safety standard
* Travel may be required


Benefits:

From versatile health perks to new career opportunities, check out our benefits on our careers website.


Employment is contingent on successful completion of a pre-employment screen, to include a drug test and an acceptable driving record. Compensation listed may reflect a combination of hourly pay rate and location pay differential.


This will be posted for a minimum of 3 days or until the position is filled.


Salary Range: USD $22.50 / Hour

title: Purchasing Buyer
description:
Full Time, 40 Hours/Week, Exempt

**Position Summary**

The incumbent will, under supervision, perform the analytical analysis involved in the procurement of goods and services by Formal Bids, Fair & Open RFP’s, Competitive Contracts and Formal Quotes. The incumbent is expected to proceed with substantial independence in analysis of contracts or creation of such, and exploring/identifying opportunities for improvement, or cost savings.

**Essential Functions**

* Incumbent will assist in routine professional work including specification development to maximize competition, proposal evaluation, award recommendation, quality assurance and execution of contract awards.
* Work is reviewed by the Purchasing Agent and is appraised in terms of quality, consistency, efficiency and compliance with County policies and statutory rules and regulations.
* Knowledge of purchasing methods and competitive bid processes in a public procurement environment, as well as general purchasing procedures and guidelines, financial computations, statistical analysis and forecasting techniques.
* Perform value analysis including research from trade journals, catalogs, and other technical material to ensure proper contracts are being utilized per market conditions.
* Ascertain prices of commodities and ability of specific item to be ordered/delivered in appropriate time line requirements.
* Maintain current knowledge of industry information for assigned services and contracts. Preparation of bid/request for proposals/quote packages (boilerplate and specifications) for a wide variety of goods and services according to accepted purchasing methods as prescribed by laws, rules, regulations, standards, policies and procedures.
* Maintain extensive knowledge of the New Jersey State Contracts and other cooperatives contracts to act as a liaison to end users for navigation and use of said contracts.
* Maintain personal liaison with department & division heads/office managers and regularly confers with them in regard to routine recurring and/or proposed procurements.
* Resolve complaints when necessary as well as rendering assistance when difficult and unusual situations arise.
* Prepare all purchasing related correspondence as it pertains to assigned solicitation of Formal Bids, Fair & Open RFP’s, Competitive Contracts, Formal Quotes and related notices.
* Excellent communication, written, oral and solid customer service skills, as well as the ability to effectively communicate with County officials and vendors/contractors.
* Attention to detail and accuracy is required.
* Possess proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
* Responsible for the management of the Somerset County Co-operative Pricing System No. 2 SOCCP.
* Requires management of contract data in the MSI.

**Essential Qualifications**

* Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor’s degree.
* Applicants who do not meet education requirements may substitute additional experience in public administration or related field on a year for year basis.
* Experience: Two (2) years of government experience related to purchasing regarding analytical analysis, specification writing/review for the purchase of equipment, supplies and services.
* Ability to comprehend and apply statutory and regulatory requirements to public contracting.
* Ability to assist in the creation of clear and concise specifications.
* Ability to establish and maintain working relationships with vendors, fifty division contracts and end users.
* Thorough knowledge of sources of supplies and services, prices, and market conditions and trends.
* Ability to work under pressure with multiple tasks and deadlines.
* Ability to plan and review workload for most proficient use of time/resources.
* Ability to work independently in a fast pace work environment.
* Attention to detail and accuracy is required.
* Possess Registered Public Procurement Specialist (RPPS) certification or in the process of completing requirements within two (2) years.

* Vision insurance

title: Area Director - Safe Haven
description:
The Bridge is an innovative and well-respected behavioral health agency serving individuals experiencing homelessness and formerly homeless adults diagnosed with serious mental illness, substance use disorder, and co-morbid medical conditions. We are seeking a manager to oversee our portfolio of DHS-funded programs which consists of one Specialized Mental Health Shelter and three Safe Havens, with a current client census of 167 individuals.

**Essential Position Functions**:

Under the supervision of the Assistant Vice President, the Area Director will be responsible for the following:

* Monitor the appropriateness and quality of standards of client care, ensuring compliance with the agency and DHS’s policies and procedures for Operation and Documentation and ensuring audit readiness.
* Directly provide supervision to program staff, and crisis intervention to clients when needed.
* 3. Oversee the operations of the programs, including interaction with the agency’s Maintenance/Facilities department and knowledge of the DHS building and Operations Manuals/documentation.
* 4. Be present at Callahan and other on-site inspections.
* Along with Program Directors, the AD will ensure that program supervisors and staff are keeping up to date with all training and certification requirements. This includes Food Handling, CPR, First Aid, and Fire Safety including the attainment of F-80 and F-02 certificates by all staff.
* Ensure the programs implement best practices such as Trauma Informed Care, Client-Centered Care, Motivational Interviewing. and Harm Reduction.
* Supervise personnel activities, including recruiting and hiring, shift scheduling, developing policies and procedures, staff meetings, staff training, performance evaluations, disciplinary actions, and labor/management issues.
* Act as the point of contact for the DHS Administrator/Analyst and assist in the communication and coordination with Outreach Teams when needed.
* Be flexible in scheduling work hours and traveling between Manhattan and Bronx locations to assist and monitor program needs. The position is on-call 24/7 and may require on-site responses on infrequent occasions.
* Any other duties as may be assigned.

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* MSW or Master’s degree in a related field.
* At least five years’ experience serving individuals experiencing homelessness and/or individuals diagnosed with a mental illness.
* Previous work in a NYC DHS Shelter and/or Safe Haven.
* Management and Supervisory experience required.
* Willingness to perform CPR/First Aid/AED/crisis de-escalation and overdose prevention (Narcan). Experience working with OTDA, DHS, and HRA.
* Knowledge of AWARDS, CARES, CAPS, SMS, and BCS, is strongly preferred.
* Bilingual (Spanish) & Driver’s License is a plus.

title: Product Consultant III
company: Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey
description:
Horizon BCBSNJ employees must live in New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Connecticut or Delaware
Job Summary:
This position is responsible for the design, development and enhancement of new and existing program across several market segments for Horizon BCBSNJ that support the company's corporate goals.* Manages the design, development and enhancement of new and existing programs across several market segments for the enterprise.
* Participates in the successful implementation and management of programs, serving as the product Subject Matter Expert (SME).
* Performs (or facilitates with internal resources) research on refining existing products/programs and evaluating potential new products/programs for the enterprise.
* Builds and manages relationships with internal staff (Sales/Account Management, Healthcare Management, Service, Underwriting, Actuarial and Information Technology) and external parties to develop product strategies and shape current product positioning.
* Manages and performs research and analysis on product performance, utilization and profitability to determine proper intervention and corrective actions when necessary.
* Analyzes and monitors competition to assure best product positioning and development.
* Supports information needs of cross-functional teams, including RFPs, that guide and support Horizons strategic mission, goals and initiatives.
* Performs product/program maintenance in support of managing the product portfolio.
* Acts as a resource to the product development staff.
* Performs other duties as assigned by management.

  

Education/Experience* Minimum high school diploma or GED
* Bachelor's degree preferred
* Requires minimum of five (5) years experience in healthcare industry and/or healthcare product/program development


Knowledge:* Must be proficient in the use of personal computers and supporting software in a Windows based environment, including MS Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and; should be knowledgeable in the use of intranet and internet applications.
* Prior P&L responsibility is preferred
* Strong working knowledge of marketing (direct, B2B, B2C, e-marketing) and customer motivation
* Proficiency with technical products
* Knowledge of health and wellness industry and relevant trend
* Requires knowledge of healthcare / health insurance industry

  

Skills and Abilities* Proven analytical, research and problem solving skills a must.
* Strong negotiation skills in addition to demonstrated relationship building and persuasive skills
* Must have effective verbal and written communication skills and demonstrate the ability to work well within a team.
* Must demonstrate professional and ethical business practices, adherence to company standards, and a commitment to personal and professional development.
* Proven time management skills are necessary. Must demonstrate the ability to manage multiple priorities or tasks, deliver timely and accurate work products with a customer service focus, and respond with a sense of urgency as required. Demonstrated ability to work in a production focused environment.
* Proven ability to ask probing questions and obtain thorough and relevant information.
* Must be client service focused with effective ability to empathize.
* Must be detail oriented with strong organizational and data processing skills. Proven ability to follow detailed instructions is essential, along with proven problem solving skills.
* Must demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and apply learning to new situations. Must exhibit flexibility to change as appropriate.
* Demonstrated ability to make decisions with little need for direction and to function effectively as a team-oriented, self-starter working across cross-functional lines.
* Experience in successfully leading cross-functional teams to achieve improvements.
* Some travel with-in NJ maybe required.


Salary Range:
$94,900 - $129,570
This compensation range is specific to the job level and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to: education, experience, licensure, certifications, geographic location, and internal equity. This range has been created in good faith based on information known to Horizon at the time of posting. Compensation decisions are dependent on the circumstances of each case. Horizon also provides a comprehensive compensation and benefits package which includes:* Comprehensive health benefits (Medical/Dental/Vision)
* Retirement Plans
* Generous PTO
* Incentive Plans
* Wellness Programs
* Paid Volunteer Time Off
* Tuition Reimbursement


Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability and any other protected class as required by federal, state or local law. Horizon will consider reasonable accommodation requests as part of the recruiting and hiring process.
company_description: Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey is an independent licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association.

title: Graphic Designer - Marketing
description:
Plus sized women’s fashion brand based in Secaucus New Jersey is looking for a full time, in
  
house Graphic Designer!
  
  

We are looking for a talented graphic designer who is passionate about creating effective visual messaging for our brand. You will be an essential part of the creative team and day to day responsibilities will include the creation of assets for print, digital, and social.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
* Presentation of inspiration and trends to aid in evolution of photography and digital channels
* Create content for digital and print channels that effectively and aesthetically communicates key messaging in a compelling way.
* Creating content for web, including homepage layout and upkeep
* Designing templates and banners for marketing emails and materials
* Executing content and providing support for socials as needed
* Work closely with marketing and creative team to understand project goals as well as contributing to the ideation of how to communicate those goals


Qualifications
  
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field preferred
* 3+ years of design experience
* Deep knowledge of adobe creative suite and industry standard graphic softwares, knowledge of motion graphics and animation a plus!
* The ability to work quickly and efficiently while adapting to changing priorities while juggling a variety of tasks and projects
* Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a fast paced and collaborative environment
* Proactive and resourceful, highly organized with strong project management skills
* Interest in fashion, experience in industry is a plus!
* Strong commitment to maintaining industry best practices

title: Director, Software Engineering (Generative AI)
description:
**Company Description**  

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.


Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking a **Director, Software Engineering** to play a pivotal role in our company's success. As a leader of several initiatives focused on implementing and innovating multimodal and generative AI technology across various engineering efforts, you will be instrumental in helping ignite how we infuse critical thinking and implement state-of-the-art techniques across the organization. Your technical expertise and leadership will be vital in modernizing how we write software, cross the "uncommon valley" of UX experiences and reduce friction, partner closely with our data science team, and cement a solid engineering culture. Your role will mentor, guide, and grow the team's skills and significantly contribute to our modern unified architecture.


Imagine being at the forefront of a critical mission. As a leader of the **Generative AI** engineering team, you will not only shape the direction of our engineering culture but also leverage generative model techniques, integrate language models for natural understanding capabilities, and enable multimodal models to comprehend a variety of different data sources throughout our ecosystem. This role demands an innovative mindset with a passion for technology-driven business transformation, and the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


To be successful, the candidate will have demonstrated experience implementing AI and ML solutions in a business context. They will also have exceptional communication skills to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and facilitate effective collaboration across different departments. Most importantly, the ideal candidate will be a leader and activist in building a diverse and inclusive workforce, a highly valued role in our company. You will create a culture of solid technical ownership, resulting in reliable products and services at scale, foster a healthy and collaborative culture that embodies NBCU's values, and continue to develop NBCU as one of the best places to work.


Your leadership will be critical in fostering a culture of efficiency and innovation within our engineering teams as well as how we collaborate with our partners in across NBCU. You will be responsible for helping root our engineering culture that in cloud-native architectures, “actions over words,” being a “friction reducer.”

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead engineering teams which will require extensive software engineering experience, especially in formulating strategy, roadmaps, and associated standards, policies, and frameworks.
* Sharp eye for quality team contribution; ability to assess team members' work product at scale.
* Analyze customer needs and develop engineering team roadmap and backlog based on organization goals and customer impact.
* Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders, including product, engineering experience, cyber security, privacy, and business solutions teams, to ensure seamless delivery.
* Drive technical excellence and innovation within the team, mentoring and developing engineers to build their skills and careers.
* Manage budgets, contracts, and relationships with vendors and partners, ensuring projects are delivered within scope and budget.
* Define and oversee the implementation of engineering policies and procedures that promote reliability, security, and compliance across all software products.
* Expertise working on a team with motivated cross-functional individuals focused on a common goal of delivering innovative solutions to meet aggressive business demands in an ever-changing environment and achieve on-time and on-budget project completion.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to relate complex information to technical and non-technical audiences with transparency and accuracy.
* Demonstrated ability to articulate complex technical themes to C-level executives.
* Ability to manage time and juggle multiple priorities to execute high-quality deliverables.
* Superior oral and written communication skills with an innate attention to detail.

  

**Qualifications** **Basic Requirements:**

* 10+ years of recent experience, with 4+ years focused on leading engineering squads demonstrating strong technical, quantitative, and analytical skills and focused on high delivery, cultural transformation and embodying a mindset of continuous learning.
* Demonstrated ability to build dynamic engineering teams, interested in continuous learning and the ability to craft an engineering culture.
* Ability to work with ambiguity and drive a forward thinking strategy.
* Develop and support the continuous development of our platform wide application foundation and architecture strategy, aligning with our growing business needs.
* Ability to maintain a roadmap for core service capabilities and interfaces that enable application and feature teams to deliver business value quickly.
* Ability to establish truth within and across product, engineering, and the business to understand business challenges and requirements. Establish trust within and across teams by creating accountability and a positive work environment in partnership with other leaders across the organizations.
* Familiarity with cloud-native development, relevant metrics (that focus not only on velocity, but drive quality), modern CI/CD toolchains and partner with our Engineering Experience team.
* Sharp eye for quality team contribution; ability to assess team member work product and attitude.
* Can assess disparate data streams and distill them into meaningful and ultimately actionable recommendations.
* Ability to easily transition between high-level strategy and day-to-day implementation.
* Experience working in a fast-paced and highly cross-functional organization.
* Results oriented, high energy, self-motivated.

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Software engineering experience as a product manager, engineer, or manager previously leading teams of engineers
* B.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field preferred
* Able to communicate effectively in a diverse team of varying skillsets and proficiencies. Able to lead and instruct or take direction when appropriate.
* Effective in-person, written and verbal communication skills.
* Experience working in large, multifaceted, and matrixed organizations.
* Experience working with remote teammates across engineering.
* Collaborative team player accustomed to working within and across groups.
* Organized and detail-oriented with ability to manage time effectively.
* Ability to translate business process needs into clear technical requirements.
* Ability to influence internal and external team members without direct reporting authority.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills with ability to relate complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong character exhibiting company core values: Integrity, Creativity, Teamwork, Pioneering Spirit, Ownership

**Additional Requirements:**

* **Fully Remote:** This position has been designated as fully remote, meaning that the position is expected to contribute from a non-NBCUniversal worksite, most commonly an employee’s residence.


This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website. Salary range: $180,000 - $230,000 *(bonus and long-term incentive eligible)*


We are accepting applications for this position on an ongoing basis.

 **Additional Information**  

NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants  

and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity  

or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual  

orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed  

services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the  

right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your  

ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can  

request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

title: Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA) / Hospice Aide
description:
**Vitality Hospice & Palliative Care is seeking an exceptional Home Health Aide to join our team!** This is a terrific opportunity to work for a clinician-owned and operated hospice agency that cares about its patients, and its employees. We offer a positive, upbeat work environment where the interdisciplinary team works together to improve symptom burden and quality of life for patients and caregivers. If caring for those on their end-of-life journey speaks to you, we would love to have you on our team!

Position is Full Time Home Health Aide position, Monday through Friday, typically 7am-3pm with occasional overtime offered on evenings/weekends.

**\\*Must have the required Home Health Aide certification to be considered for this traveling CHHA position\\*** 

**Responsibilities:**

As a Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA), you will work in collaboration and under the supervision of a Registered Nurse Case Manager. As a Home Health Aide you will put your skills to work in support of daily activities that may include assisting patients with getting in and out of bed, dressing, grooming, hygiene, feeding, assistance with ambulatory transfers, and light housekeeping. The nurturer you are, will provide emotional support and companionship to patients. The role requires team members to travel throughout the surrounding areas to patients to provide care.

We are looking for customer service-minded, compassionate, and DEPENDABLE team members. **LOOKING TO HIRE IMMEDIATELY!**

**Benefits:**

* Comprehensive Health, Dental, & Vision Insurance
* Company matching 401(k) to secure your future
* Paid Time Off/Holiday Pay
* Year-end bonuses and periodic situational bonuses based on performance
* Company sponsored team appreciation events
* Mileage reimbursement
* Referral Program
* Tap Check: pay-on-demand. Cash out earned money when and where you need it!
* Professional development and career growth opportunities

**Qualifications:**

* Current Home Health Aide Certification
* Must have a valid drivers’ license with reliable transportation and liability insurance
* Self-directing with the ability to work with little direct supervision
* Empathy for the needs of the ill, injured, frail and the impaired
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to read and follow written instructions and document care given
* Good time management skills and ability to deliver documentation timely

If you meet these qualifications, we want to meet you!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $22.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Mileage reimbursement
* Paid time off
* Travel reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Hospice & Palliative Medicine

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)
* NJ CHHA (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: Assistant General Manager
description:
The Gig:


At District Taco our managers don’t just manage but lead their Teams! You will be responsible for creating and maintaining a great Guest experience by ensuring that our food is prepared and served in a safe manner while maintaining our high-quality standards. You will assist the GM in the day-to-day operations of our restaurants – learning the steps and commitment it takes to run a strong business, hire and train a great team and help grow DT. If this sounds like you and up for the challenge, we’d like to meet you!


Assistant General Manager Core Responsibilities:

* Maintaining quality by monitoring staff and sampling products at various stages of production
* Enforcing District Taco's safe food handling practices using the HACCP plan
* Working to ensure that the restaurant opens and closes according to company standards
* Communicating concerns and needs with supervisors and staff
* Assessing general enthusiasm and morale to find ways to improve Team Member wellbeing
* Working towards healthy communication among team members
* Monitoring labor and COGs information, and reviewing budget data for store
* Creating weekly schedules for Team Members based on historic and projected sales data
* Ensuring that Team Members receive proper training and guidance
* Communicating clear expectations to Team Members and guiding staff to ensure prescribed goals are met
* Consulting the Regional Manager regarding addition or termination of first-tier management staff
* Acknowledging positive and negative behavior through performance reviews and disciplinary action
* Reviewing payroll information and monitoring hourly labor percentage
* Reconciling invoices and surveilling current inventory
* Maintaining organization of storage areas to ensure rotation of goods
* Assessing needs and ordering supplies for the restaurant
* Controlling alcohol sales to ensure proper handling guidelines are met
* Coordinating cash deposits and managing the petty cash account
* Examining all equipment and requesting repairs or replacement as needed
* Proposing solutions to the Area Manager for complex problems
* Resolving customer service issues if they arise
  

  

Assistant General Manager Qualifications:

* Proficiency in reading, writing, speaking and understanding English
* Strong interpersonal/people skills
* High level of motivation and sense of self-responsibility
* Ability to apply and maintain standards of cleanliness, sanitation, and personal hygiene
* Ability to demonstrate outstanding customer service skills on an ongoing basis
* Be physically active for long periods without getting tired or out of breath
* Stand and/or walk for 8 consecutive hours
* Use stomach and lower back muscles to support the body
* Coordinate movement of several parts of the body, such as arms and legs, while the body is moving
* Hold the arm and hand in one position or hold the hand steady while moving the arm
* Lift, push, pull, or carry heavy objects for long periods without getting tired
* Lift 50lbs or more on a regular basis
* Work efficiently in a variety of hot or cold environments (e.g. refrigerated areas, close to cooking equipment, etc.)
* Knowledge of Food Safety and health department policies
* Basic business knowledge – P&L management, sales-forecasting, staffing, etc.

Fully vaccinated or in the process of being fully vaccinated for COVID-19. If a job offer is extended, such offer is contingent upon you providing proof that you are fully vaccinated or in the process of being fully vaccinated for COVID-19. District Taco will make appropriate accommodations for successful applicants who provide documentation of a valid covered medical reason or sincerely held religious belief or practice that prevents you from being vaccinated.  
* 


INDMANAGE

title: Litigation Paralegal
description:
Join a Leading Litigation Firm as a Litigation Paralegal – Hybrid Role in Melville, NY!

Trustpoint.one is proud to partner with one of the top litigation firms in the U.S. to bring you this exciting opportunity. We’re searching for a talented **Litigation Paralegal** with a background in litigation or law firm experience to join a high-performing team. This is a ***full-time, hybrid position*** located in **Melville, NY**.

**Why You'll Love This Role:**

As a key player in a prestigious U.S. litigation firm, you’ll be immersed in a range of impactful litigation support activities. From reviewing complex documents and preparing trial materials to collaborating with attorneys and clients, you’ll be at the center of meaningful legal work.

**Key Responsibilities:**

- Analyze and review critical documents such as medical, financial, and employment records.

- Craft detailed medical chronologies.

- Prepare trial notebooks, exhibits, and witness files for litigation cases.

- Collaborate with attorneys to compile crucial evidence and case support.

- Manage court docket calendars and ensure deadlines are met.

- Coordinate with clients, opposing law firms, and courts.

- Conduct legal research and provide analysis on case issues.

- Generate reports, logs, and case indexes.

- Engage with clients and opposing firms through correspondence.

- Contribute to the success of the team through various additional duties as needed.

**What You’ll Bring:**

- Experience: A minimum of 2 years of litigation or casualty experience is essential.

- Education: A Bachelor’s or Associate’s degree is required, with a Paralegal Certificate from an ABA-approved program (preferred).

- Skills: Strong interpersonal, organizational, and multi-tasking abilities. A collaborative spirit and ability to prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment are key.

- Teamwork: A dedication to fostering a supportive, cooperative work atmosphere.

**Why Work with Us:**

Through our partnership with one of the top litigation firms in the country, Trustpoint.one offers an exclusive opportunity to be part of a high-caliber legal team. Here, you’ll find opportunities for growth and the chance to make a significant impact in high-stakes litigation.

*All candidates must be able to work at a computer screen for a sustained amount of time*.

*Trustpoint.One provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Experience:

* Litigation Support: 2 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Melville, NY 11747 (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Melville, NY 11747

title: Construction Project Manager
description:
**Reports to**: Director of Construction & Design


With a projected 1,000 cafes in the United States by 2030, Paris Baguette is one of the fastest-growing neighborhood bakery cafés in the world. Paris Baguette’s mission is to bring expertly crafted baked and brewed goods through a warm and welcoming bakery café experience that delivers joy to everyone.


At Paris Baguette, we serve up graciousness and are happy to put the needs of others first. We are attentive and accommodating to our guests and to each other. We mix in a little love, comfort and compassion into our work every step of the way. We work diligently with a dedication to quality at our core, taking ownership of our actions and decisions. We hold ourselves accountable to our word. We face challenges head on, and when the bar is set high, we have the conviction to clear it with confidence.


If you are someone who has heart, wants to spread joy and is ready to rise to the occasion, we are looking for you to join our growing team!

**WHAT WE ARE HUNGRY FOR**


The Construction Project Manager is responsible for the implementation of Design & Construction guidelines and managing all architectural and construction activities involved with new and remodeled locations. This position provides ongoing professional construction and design assistance to Paris Baguette, prototype improvements and supervises the development process, including construction; Incorporates process driven improvements as appropriate. The ideal candidate will leverage construction and design knowledge to help achieve our vision of re-establishing the neighborhood bakery café as the heart of the community around the world.

**KNOWLEDGE AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Manage all facets of project development process for new locations including layouts, CD’s, construction and openings.
* Supervise and maintain the construction process while managing the construction of new locations.
* Manage preferred Architects and General Contractors and source others as needed.
* Prepare scope of work, project delivery requirements, cost estimates and risk identification as required for projects.
* Track progress of all projects against approved timelines and goals. Reports on project status and potential delays and then implements an action plan to meet objectives as needed for on time opening.
* Implement the company’s business policies, programs, specifications and procedures related to planning, design and construction of Paris Baguette locations
* Undertake all reasonable measures to ensure that all agreed too new store build/ relocations/ remodels are met for franchisee markets.
* Provide bakery/franchise design assistance and construction project management support to the teams in order to ensure new openings and redevelopments are up to corporate standards.
* Keep abreast of bakery/franchise industry practice regarding development plans, design standards and related cost and maintain liaison with Paris Baguette team in order to identify, cascade, and implement global programs and regional initiatives.
* Provide bakery/franchise design assistance and construction project management support to the teams in order to ensure new openings and redevelopments are up to corporate standards
* Perform other tasks, as needed

**WHAT YOU NEED TO HAVE**

* Bachelor’s degree in Architecture, Construction or related field
* At least, 5-7 years Architecture/Construction experience in Commercial/Retail/Hospitality/Entertainment industry
* Experience in the Architectural field including commercial and retail related activities
* Progressive leadership experience in a fast paced and rapidly growing retail environment. Must have a proven multi-unit restaurant operations background leading 100 plus locations.
* Experience with a fast growing Franchise company is required.
* Experience with high velocity new store openings required.
* Bakery/Café experience preferred.
* Flexible, adaptive, upbeat, open and visible management style, with a successful record of accomplishment of managing senior operations leaders across a large geographically decentralized portfolio.
* Passion for people! Dynamic and engaged leader who has a passion for empowering, inspiring, motivating & developing team members.
* Exceptional organizational and communication skills with the ability to effectively balance priorities and deliver results in a fast-paced, ever-changing, and highly entrepreneurial environment.
* Feedback is a gift! Ability to provide constructive feedback and recognition to every member of the organization, to ensure we have an open and transparent culture of high performance standards.
* High emotional intelligence with the ability to work with, and manage diverse teams by being highly empathetic, intuitive, self-motivated and driven.
* Teams Win! Has to be a team player who fosters a collaborative and engaged teamwork environment.
* Being a Brand Ambassador, with an excellent knowledge of and commitment to Paris Baguette’s Mission, Vision, Brand Values and Culture.
* Love of travel! Ability to commute to all current Corporate and Franchise locations, as well as proposed openings.

**SWEET BENEFITS**

* Competitive compensation
* Free Cake for your Birthday
* Medical, Dental, Vision benefits
* 401K Retirement Plan
* Paid time off, paid Holidays, as per company policy
* High Performance Culture


INDHEADOFFICE

title: Assistant Project Manager
description:
**Summary:**

Milrose Consultants, in partnership with Project Expediters Consulting Company – a nationwide permit and entitlement expediting firm – is seeking an Assistant Project Manager for their Utility Permitting Department. With over three decades of expertise, Milrose has established itself as the leading national provider of building code compliance, fulfillment, and consulting solutions, serving thousands of clients, municipal agencies, and utility providers across the United States. From due diligence to code analysis, land use, zoning analysis, and special inspections to occupancy approval, Milrose is known for its long-term relationships and industry leadership.

This position requires in-person attendance four (4) days per week at our Manalapan, NJ office, with an option to work from home one day per week.

**Responsibilities:**

* Support the Project Manager to Initiate Service Order which may include being tasked with the following:
* Assist in preparing and submitting utility applications.
* Request Load Letters from the Engineer of Record (EOR) or Architect of Record (AOR).
* Submit necessary documentation, including load letters, utility applications, site plans, and relevant plumbing and electrical drawings, to the utility company for gas and electric services. Additionally, provide a Google Earth image of the property to clearly identify the site.
* For water and sewer services, submit the application and utility site plan. Additional documents may be provided if requested by the utility department.
* Follow up with the utility department to ensure a Utility Engineer is assigned to the project.
* Schedule and coordinate onsite meetings with the utility department, client, and contractor (once awarded).
* Ensure all necessary documentation, including invoices, easements, and client signatures, are collected and submitted to the utility department for order processing.
* Track and follow up on payments with the client and contractor to ensure timely processing.
* Provide the project team with critical information such as account numbers and associated meter numbers.
* Ensure the correct transfer of billing information to the client for accurate billing.
* Obtain necessary Will Serve Letters and address designations to support the project.

**Education and/ or Experience:**

* 3-5 years of relevant experience preferred, particularly in roles involving architectural or civil engineering firms.
* Strong oral and written communication skills are essential, along with solid listening abilities.
* Excellent organizational skills and problem-solving abilities, with the capacity to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Capable of working independently, leading a team, and collaborating with other internal departments effectively.
* Strong ability to research, interpret, and communicate through various municipality portals or websites.
* Demonstrate flexibility in satisfying customer demands in a high-volume production environment while maintaining the highest levels of customer care and a friendly, cooperative attitude in both verbal and written communication.
* Highly proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel (creation and editing), PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, and Adobe Acrobat.

title: Associate Fashion Editor
description:
Condé Nast is a global media company producing the highest quality content with a footprint of more than 1 billion consumers in 32 territories through print, digital, video and social platforms. The company’s portfolio includes many of the world’s most respected and influential media properties including Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler/Traveller, Allure, AD, Bon Appétit and Wired, among others.
Job Description
Location:
New York, NY
Overview/Purpose  

The Associate Fashion Editor is a member of the Global Fashion Network. They are responsible for providing support for all fashion editorial and projects. They work closely with the Senior Fashion Editor in executing fashion editorial across all platforms. This role also has the expectation to ideate fashion ideas across platforms - print, digital, e-commerce, events, etc. They must have experience and the professionalism required to appropriately participate in editorial meetings, brand discussions, etc. Along with the Fashion Assistant, they help provide on the ground logistical support for fashion shoots - packing of trunks, messengers, sample tracking, etc. As part of the GFN, this role also offers support to other brands within the network when needed.
Responsibilities include:* Work directly with Senior Fashion Editor, communicating daily about upcoming fashion stories, projects and fashion market work
* Supports the execution of all fashion projects including managing run-throughs, fittings, sample tracking
* Ideation of fashion ideas across platforms, video, print, e commerce, events, etc
* Attend market appointments as needed
* May be solely responsible for specific markets
* Existing strong relationships with fashion brand PR representatives, effective communication with brands
* Assist stylists with fittings and on set as needed
* Work with Fashion Assistant on shoot logistics; arranging messengers, packing trunks, tracking and check-in of samples, etc.
* Represent brand at industry events as determined by Editor
* Assist with other brands in the Global Fashion Network as needed
* Style shoots and act as sittings editor, as determined by Editor
* Manage fashion credits post shoot, in collaboration with fashion assistant


Desired skills & qualifications:* Existing relationships with key fashion brand PR representatives
* Knowledge of of fashion industry, designers, brands as well as culture at large
* Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines
* Works collaboratively
* Extremely organized, detail oriented, problem solvers
* Excellent communication skills, excitement about fashion and position
* Working fashion experience
* Strong communication skills


This is a guild position.
The expected base salary range for this position is from $65,000-$70,000. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including but not limited to relevant skills, training, experience, and education.
What happens next?
If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply below, and we will review your application as soon as possible. You can update your resume or upload a cover letter at any time by accessing your candidate profile.*Condé Nast is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status and other legally protected characteristics.*

title: Director, Business Development, Licensing
description:
Condé Nast is a global media company producing the highest quality content with a footprint of more than 1 billion consumers in 32 territories through print, digital, video and social platforms. The company’s portfolio includes many of the world’s most respected and influential media properties including Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler/Traveller, Allure, AD, Bon Appétit and Wired, among others.
Job Description
Location:
New York, NY
With iconic, multi-generational brands including Vogue, The New Yorker, Vanity Fair,
Condé Nast Traveler, Architectural Digest, and Wired, Condé Nast is
seeking to expand the relevancy, authority, and value that our brands offer to our
global consumers through product licensing and partnerships.
The Director of Business Development and Licensing will report to and work closely with the Senior Director of Global Licensing to develop and execute the licensing strategy for individual brands in the US market. This will involve identifying product and retail partners and implementing branded products and promotional initiatives to engage consumers with our brands, thereby increasing loyalty and driving profitable growth. This sales role is responsible for driving revenue for the consumer products licensing business and is located at the NYC headquarters.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:* Achieving annual revenue targets with a focus on sustained profitability
* Analyzing the retail landscape, finding new opportunities for licensing deals and partnership opportunities that will support the growth of Condé Nast’s brands
* Identifying and securing best-in-class licensees through a proactive strategic framework for each brand
* Developing expertise in each relevant licensed category and serving as the primary resource for these categories by thoroughly understanding the market, competitors, and capabilities of each potential licensee
* Structuring and negotiating business terms with both speed and holistic POV
* Managing and nurturing current and new licensed programs with a cross-functional team internally (editorial, commercial, research, legal, and finance) and licensee/partner stakeholders


The ideal candidate has:* 10+ years of licensing/consumer products experience
* A proven track record in building and scaling brand-led licensing programs for premium brands
* A strong US network of business development contacts, including manufacturers and retailers
* Expertise in negotiation and deal construction and fluency in complex legal and business issues in contracts with the ability to develop creative solutions
* Ability to work successfully with cross-functional teams
* Proficiency in financial modeling and revenue forecasting
* Strong program/project management skills and a thorough understanding of the product development process
* Excellent organization and communication skills
* Salary Range: $120k-150k
